basics.name: Ruicheng Yang
basics.label: M.S. Student in Computational Social Science
basics.summary: A Master's student in Computational Social Science at UC San Diego, with a background in Sociology from Anhui University. Passionate about applying computational methods, machine learning, and statistical analysis to social science research.

work.name: Institute of Geographic Sciences and Natural Resources Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences
work.summary: Conducted research on land use changes and urban ecological degradation.
highlights: Analyzed land use changes in 3 regions over 4 decades using ArcGIS software
Accessed extensive literature from Web of Science, ScienceDirect, Google Scholar
Analyzed indicators related to urban ecological degradation
Engaged in assessing potential impacts of urban ecosystem policies

work.name: Jianghuai Tribune, Anhui Academy of Social Sciences
work.summary: Supported academic journal publication and rural revitalization research.
highlights: Developed rural revitalization investigation
Edited and proofread 20+ academic journal articles
Attended manuscript revision seminars as conference secretary

courses: Statistical Methods for Computational Social Science

projects.name: Neural Data Decomposition for Hidden Population Discovery
projects.summary: Capstone Project at UCSD — Director: Dr. Meenakshi Khosla
highlights: Developing a Python-based computational pipeline to demix high-dimensional neural signals using matrix factorization
Utilizing GPU clusters to perform dimensionality reduction and factor analysis of brain data
Evaluating component stability through cross-validation and interpreting functional significance

projects.name: Embracing Community: Urban Public Cultural Space Construction and Governance
projects.summary: National-level Project — National College Students' Innovative Entrepreneurial Training Plan Program
highlights: Explored governance mechanism of urban public space with theories of urban gentrification and spatial politics
Conducted field research collecting 200+ valid responses from community residents and social workers
Analyzed effectiveness of existing policies and proposed recommendations for optimizing urban public space governance

projects.name: Sociological Research and Quantitative Analysis Methods in a Global Context
projects.summary: Online Course Experience — Instructor: Prof. Parfait from Cornell University
highlights: Traced the shifts in developmental theory from early optimism to recent pessimism
Undertook quantitative and qualitative studies of global evolution, population growth, social equity
Extracted data from CGSS2021 (2,735 samples) for quantitative and qualitative analyses
Independently authored article on Education and Environment-Friendly Behavior

projects.name: Gender Preferences, Family Support and Fertility Intention Studies
projects.summary: Course Project for Statistics Software — Empirical Evidence from CFPS
highlights: Filtered sample size of 3,404 men and women aged 22-44 from CFPS2018
Built OLS and Poisson regression models for data analysis
Contributed paper on impact of gender preferences and family support on fertility intentions

projects.name: Enhancement of Young Married Women's Fertility Intentions Based on Youth-Friendly Cities
projects.summary: Provincial-level Project (No.S202310357540) — National College Students' Innovative Entrepreneurial Training Plan Program

Designed fertility intention questionnaire and distributed to 117 young married women
Used SPSS to analyze data revealing low satisfaction with fertility support policies
Proposed 9 policy optimization paths, affirmed by Anhui Women's Federation

Analyzed rural digital tourism feasibility and designed logo endorsed by village council
